published_attributes.title: Welcome to Salesforce intro course 👋
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Who is it for?

The course is designed for Netguru Project Managers, Product Managers, Project Coordinators, Agile Coaches, and Scrum Masters.

What is it for?

The course is to provide the general intro to Netguru Salesforce. The use cases are chosen for the roles mentioned above.

Why NOT to take this course?

This is not an advanced course for Salesforce analytics neither a course for Salesforce developers. If you feel you could be mentoring others from Netguru Salesforce, you most probably won't find anything totally new in this course.

What are the course prerequisites?

No prior knowledge to Salesforce is required. You would need an active Netguru Salesforce account to complete challenges prepared. If you do not have it yet, just ask at NG Service Desk or ask your mentor/leader for assistance.

The course is video-driven. Analytics section is recommended to be watched on a bigger screen if possible. If your learning style is more about raw text, I suggest NG SF Confluence space & uncle Google as a better fit.

The chapters are cut into short micro-learning journeys, no need to take the whole course at once. The analytics part has a bit longer chapters than the rest due to its case nature.

published_attributes.title: Agenda & Author
published_attributes.serialized_body:
What does the course cover?

  1. Welcome Salesforce basics
  2. What's Salesforce?
  3. What do we use Salesforce for at Netguru?
  4. Different apps, the same database
  5. Make it productive
  6. How to move around?
  7. Looking for people info?
  8. Wanna edit your commercial profile?
  9. Contact use cases
  10. Challenge1 🚀 Joining a project
  11. Project: Netguru Matrix & Project Health
  12. Project: Weekly Update decomposed
  13. Project: Team Assignments
  14. Project: Business Context
  15. Project: KB, Invoicing, and Documentation
  16. How is Source related? Salesforce analytics
  17. Salesforce analytics intro
  18. Let's get hands dirty with reports
  19. Reporting hands-on experience
  20. Dashboards in a nutshell
  21. How to create your own dashboard?
  22. Challenge 2 🌎 Summary
  23. Wanna learn more about Salesforce?
  24. Useful links
  25. Feedback

Who is the author?

The course is created by a Senior Project Manager & Salesforce enthusiast. Ewa has spent 2.5K hours working at NG Salesforce project and she's been a Netgural since 2018. The analytics section is supported by Igor, Netguru Salesforce Admin.

published_attributes.title: Wanna edit your commercial profile?
published_attributes.serialized_body:
NG Profiles are used by BD & PMO on a daily basis to present Netgurals to our clients. You need to know how to help creating the base of such a CV 🤓

Project history is built automatically from your assignments & milestones, the rest relies on skills assessment & bio section. Apart from almighty SF admin account, the edition is available to a profile owner, BD, and PMO.

published_attributes.title: Project: Netguru Matrix & Project Health
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Imagine you joined some project. Let's discover 👀 what Salesforce can offer in terms of projects and how you can use it on a daily basis.

Project is a core NG Salesforce object used for working on project data. In this part we will cover the basics of how to work with Netguru Matrix and Project Health.

blocks.text: Imagine you joined some project. Let's discover 👀 what Salesforce can offer in terms of projects and how you can use it on a daily basis.
Project is a core NG Salesforce object used for working on project data. In this part we will cover the basics of how to work with Netguru Matrix and Project Health.

published_attributes.title: Project: Weekly Update decomposed
published_attributes.serialized_body:
In this part we will decompose Weekly Update. We will add one update and search for previous project history.

Weekly updates are added by PMs and they're the main source of Project Health data. They are great source of project information when you join a project or want to verify what's been happening at some other project. Whenever a weekly update is added to SF, a notification is sent to a given project biz channel.

published_attributes.title: Project: KB, Invoicing, and Documentation
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Final 3 tabs cover Knowledgebase, Invoicing, and Documentation tabs.

In the first one you will find project milestones and skillset used. The next serves for adding invoice adjustments or checking invoice list per project. The last one serves as the folder for all the rest project information that has not been mentioned yet.

published_attributes.title: Salesforce analytics intro
published_attributes.serialized_body:
We already learnt about basic SF objects & fields. Time to glue it together.

Welcome to data processing part of this course 🥳 For the data housewarming party we invited Igor Kujawa, NG Salesforce Admin.

published_attributes.title: Let's get hands dirty with reports
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Let's take baby steps and start with something simple. Login to Salesforce and build the first report with us 💪

If you want to keep the result, remember to save the outcome in your folder. In SF you can create and share folders similarly as you do it at G-suite. To provide an access to a report you need to provide the access to the folder where the report is placed.

You can provide 3 types of accesses: view/edit/manage.

published_attributes.title: Congratulations 🥳 Go & Salesforce!
published_attributes.serialized_body:
You have just learnt the basics of Netguru Salesforce world. Go and explore more in the system itself. Whatever is available for you, is there for you to use. Take benefit of Salesforce power connected with Netguru database!

This has been my first course in Bridge. I would appreciate your feedback to know what you found useful, to what extent did it meet your expectations, and what improvements you suggest.

Happy Salesforce using!
